name: Ibis Rouen Centre Rive Droite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location on the river easy to find. 10 min stroll into town. Modern clean and good value standard Ibis
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at this Ibis in Rouen, we had a good size room, very clean with the standard set up for this type of hotel.
reviews.title: Good value hotel

likes.liked: — Good value, easy walking distance to close to city centre
likes.disliked: — No hairdryer in the room (minor niggle!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good value for a hotel very close to a city centre, it is only a 10 minute walk to the city centre but not quite the 'stroll along the banks of the Seine' that is described on the website - there is a busy dual carriageway between you and the Seine! Although I'm sure it is possible to cross this at some point and walk along the river.
reviews.title: Our First Ibis
Good surprise
reviews.text: We stayed on a Saturday night and had no problem in parking despite not arriving until around 7pm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We showed up without a reservation at sister hotel Mercure and found they were fully booked, so the front desk called the Ibis and secured us their last room. The room was clean, the beds comfortable, but no a/c made it warm and stuffy. With the window open it was too noisy. The location was slightly out of the way, so we ate in the restaurant. the food was so-so, but the price was right and the restaurant was bright and airy. Most of the patrons at the hotel appeared to be business people and rugby players.
reviews.title: No problems and a great price

likes.disliked: — Trying to charge for breakfasts not eaten

reviews.title: Any redeeming features?
reviews.text: Stayed for one night at the Ibis Rouen. We only chose it because of the car park (which would have been fine if it wasn't full of contractor's vehicles working on the hotel and if the parking bays weren't so narrow because of the trees between them).

description: The Ibis Rouen Centre Rive Droite is located 10 minutes walk from the historic city centre of Rouen. Close to the place du Vieux Marche, shopping streets, cinemas and the Prefecture, the hotel offers 88 airconditioned rooms with WiFi access (including three for guests with limited mobility). The hotel also features a restaurant, a bar, 24 hour snack service, a meeting room, a terrace and two private pay car parks (60 vehicles).
